Detailed Description

Allows for extended input and output options during encryption.

Property Documentation

◆ EnablePortionMarking

bool IonicSecurity::SDK::FileCryptoEncryptAttributes::EnablePortionMarking
getset

Enable or disable portion marking.

Parameters
[in]bEnablePortionMarkingDetermines if portion marking is enabled.

Portion marking is a feature which allows sub-sections (portions) of a document to be protected with a different level of security than the entire document. For example, a credit card number could be marked so that only the document creator can see it, but no other consumer of the document could.

Portion marking is not relevant for all file formats. Currently, portion marking is only relevant for Microsoft Word documents, which should be protected using the OpenXmlFileCipher class.

◆ PortionMarkingClassifications

Dictionary< String^, String^>^ IonicSecurity::SDK::FileCryptoEncryptAttributes::PortionMarkingClassifications
getset

Set the names of the classifications to use when portion marking is enabled.

Parameters
[in]dictClassificationsDictionary of color value keys to classification name values.

Color names must be one of "green", "blue", "red", "darkYellow", or sections will not be encrypted. The default color names used for portion marking are: "green" = "Restricted" "blue" = "Confidential" "red" = "Top Secret" "darkYellow" = "Secret" All colors to be used must be specified in the input to this map. This map overrides all default values. If, for example, "green" is not in the map but other colors are, a document portion marked with green will not have that section encrypted. An empty map can be specified to restore use of the default values.
